meanings.definition: To make a serious or urgent request.
meanings.sent1: I will appeal to my teacher for help with my homework.
meanings.sent2: The charity's cause will appeal to many kind-hearted people.
meanings.sent3: I will appeal to my mom for extra cookies after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a picnic in the park appeals to me.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's sad eyes appeal to my sense of compassion.

meanings.sent1: The colorful book cover will appeal to young readers.
meanings.sent2: The new movie trailer appeals to a wide audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing a banana costume to school may appeal to some students.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger's smile appealed to her sense of adventure.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of freshly baked cookies appeals to my senses.

meanings.definition: A request made to a higher court for a decision to be overturned.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer filed an appeal to challenge the court's ruling.
meanings.sent2: The defendant's appeal was successful, and the verdict was overturned.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow was like an appeal for attention.
meanings.sent4: The appeal to the Supreme Court was a last resort for justice.
meanings.sent5: The appeal process can be lengthy and complex in legal matters.
